Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
avosts - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Help.Tip: Maximum number of CDPs per line.
Help.Text:
avosts - NCDP_MAX
Maximum number of CDPs per line.
 
 Default = 500
 Allowed = greater than 0, less than 20000
 Maximum number of CDPs per line.

Help.Tip: Start time of analysis window (msec).
Help.Text:
avosts - STIM_WIN
Start time of analysis window (msec).
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = greater than or equal to 0, less than or equal to 99999
 Start time of analysis window (msec).

Help.Tip: End time of analysis window (msec).
Help.Text:
avosts - ETIM_WIN
End time of analysis window (msec).
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = greater than or equal to 0, less than or equal to 99999
 End time of analysis window (msec).

Help.Tip: Time duration of correlation window (msec).
Help.Text:
avosts - CWIN_TIM
Time duration of correlation window (msec).
 
 Default = 500
 Allowed = greater than or equal to 10, less than or equal to 5000
 Time duration or correlation window (msec).

Help.Tip: Spatial extent of correlation window (CDPs).
Help.Text:
avosts - CWIN_CDP
Spatial extent of correlation window (CDPs).
 
 Default = 21
 Allowed = greater than 1, less than or equal to 99999
 Spatial extent of correlation window (CDPs).

Help.Tip: Vertical shift of correlation window (msec).
Help.Text:
avosts - CWIN_VSH
Vertical shift of correlation window (msec).
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = greater than or equal to -5000, less than or equal to 5000
 Vertical shift of correlation window.

Help.Tip: Correlation weighting option.
Help.Text:
avosts - CORR_OPT
Correlation weighting option.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = NO, LIN, SQR
 Correlation weighting option:
   NO -> No weighting; strong events dominate over weak.
   LIN -> Inverse linear; strong events contribute less than NO.
   SQR -> Inverse square; strong and weak events contribute equally.

Help.Tip: Pass pre-stack data?
Help.Text:
avosts - PASS_OPT
Pass pre-stack data?
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed = NO, YES
 Pass pre-stack data?

Help.Tip: Level of debugging print.
Help.Text:
avosts - DBUG_OPT
Level of debugging print.
 
 Default = SILENT
 Allowed = SILENT, INFORMATION, MEM_CHECK, EXIT_CODES, EVERYTHING
 Level of debugging print:
   SILENT -> Minimal diagnostic print.
   INFORMATION -> Print CDPs processes and their statistics.
   MEM_CHECK -> Frequenty verify memory integrity.
   EXIT_CODES -> Exit codes are additionally checked.
   EVERYTHING -> Full debug print is requested.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
avosts - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
avosts - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
avosts - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
avosts - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
avosts - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
avosts - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
avosts - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
avosts - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
avosts - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
avosts - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
avosts - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : AVOSTS
 Category   : velocity_analysis
 Written    : 2003-08-26   by: Bill Lucas
 Revised    : 2006-06-20   by: B. Menger
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : AVO Standard Suite (AVOSTS).
 Portability: No known limitations.
 Parallel   : No.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 This tool computes a standard suite of traces (described below) for every
 pair of 'A' and 'B' traces passed to it from AVEL. The standard suite is
 the basic input for every other tool in the ARCO AVO Seismic Workbench.
 This tool actually invokes the AVO Overburden Correction (UHCI) tool with
 a restricted set of user inputs.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          ADVICE FOR USERS
 
 None.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date        Author     Description
     ----        ------     -----------
002. 2006-06-20  B. Menger   Removed Unused Variables.
  1. 2005-01-03  B. Lucas   Initial version.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
